qas.question: In the past have relations between Ashkenazim and Sephardim tended to be warm or cold?
How did the Ashkenazim view north African Sepharadim and Berber Jews?
Who led the Israeli Black Panthers?
What did Saadia Marciano do with the Israeli Black Panthers?

context: Relations between Ashkenazim and Sephardim <a0_0>have not always been warm<a0_0/>. North African Sepharadim and Berber Jews were often looked upon by Ashkenazim <a1_0>as second-class citizens<a1_0/> during the first decade after the creation of Israel. This has <a4_0>led to protest movements<a4_0/> such as the Israeli Black Panthers led by <a2_0>Saadia Marciano<a2_0/> a <a3_0>Moroccan Jew<a3_0/>. Nowadays, relations are getting better. In some instances, Ashkenazi communities have accepted significant numbers of Sephardi newcomers, sometimes resulting in intermarriage.
